content:
Do we have cyclic numbers? In the sense that a number N is cyclic if all groups of cardinality N are cyclic. See the wikipedia page for more details.

The closest thing I found is docs#isAddCyclic_of_prime_card, what I want is more along the lines of docs#isAddCyclic_of_card_coprime_totient which is not there : (
and I couldn’t find anything with loogle/moogle
I don't think we have anything like that
Luigi Massacci has marked this topic as resolved.
I don't know if this helps, but cyclic numbers are sometimes called "Burnside numbers", since the characterization is often attributed to Burnside. However, I could not find an original reference.
:shrug: nothing found
:shrug: nothing found
@Scott Carnahan thank you but it seems I'm out of luck, I'll just have to do it myself if I want it
